text: "Million Reasons" is a song recorded by American singer-songwriter Lady Gaga. It is the seventh track on her fifth studio album, Joanne. The song became the second single from the album on October 28, 2016, after "Perfect Illusion". Gaga wrote the song with Mark Ronson and Hillary Lindsey, while she produced it with Ronson. The song first reached number 52 on the Billboard Hot 100. Gaga performed the song as the second-to-last song from her Super Bowl 51 halftime show, before "Bad Romance". After her show, "Million Reasons" reentered at number four on the Hot 100. It became her 10th top-five and 14th top-ten song in the US. She performed it as the encore song on the piano on the Joanne World Tour. It was nominated for the Grammy Award for Best Pop Solo Performance at the 60th ceremony in 2018 but lost to "Shape of You" by Ed Sheeran. The Recording Industry Association of America certified the song Platinum for sales and streams of over one million copies in the US alone. ==References== Category:2016 songs Category:Lady Gaga songs Category:Pop ballads Category:2010s ballads
